Posts.Title: Question about a tender spot in breast, No lumps. kehjj04 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: kehjj04 wrote: Hi there.  My name is Erin.  Im 26.  I have 3 small children and one on the way.  Im 25 weeks pregnant.  In October i had a clean mammo of both breasts (i had a "lump" that wouldent show up on US or mammo, turned out to be a rib bone!)  I got pregnant the next month. I have very lumpy breasts (as my breast surgeon as told me over and over :) and have a few cysts that i have had ultrasounds on in the past.  For the past 2 months i have had this spot on the side of my breast, closest to my arm, that is tender ONLY if i push on it.  I bought a bigger bra, stopped sleeping on that side and stopped carrying my 2 year old on that side and it has not helped at all.  Today i saw a Dr (ob) that i do not care for.  He is always very rushed and kinda rude.  He did a very throrugh breast exam on both sides and felt around extensively in the area that feels "bruised"  he said he did not feel any thing at all (i dont either, there is no lump just pain)  he said that if he felt something that he would order an ultrasound but becasue he doesnt feel anything, hes not going to.  This kinda disappointed me.  I caught my favorite OB as i was leaving in the hallway and she said that next month if its still there she will order a US for my peace of mind. what do yall think i should do?  Does anyone have any opinions of what this could be?  I have ALOT of anxiety when it comes to my breasts and im just looking for some help :) Blessed to have all B9 results in the past. Praying for all B9 findings in the future. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2011 07:50PM kehjj04 wrote: My fathers mother had breast cancer after menopause.  She had a lumpectomy and chemo.  I was really young i just remember taking her for her treatments.  This is what my dr said.  about the pregnancy and everything.  But im one of those like....lets make sure theres nothing there, over a lets wait and see.  This dr was very like, lets wait until you deliver since i dont feel a lump.  But i also breastfeed for at least a year too.....Im just scared.  Ive been looking for any kind of info on spots that are tender only when pushed with no palpable lump and im really coming up empy handed.  That area has what the dr called "fibrocystic changes" so maybe there is just a cyst that is causing the pain.  idk :(

Posts.Title: Question about a tender spot in breast, No lumps. kehjj04 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 07:03AM kehjj04 wrote: The ob that i saw the other day said he felt nothing out of the ordinary so he didnt order an ultrasound (i had a baseline mammogram done on that breast the month before i got pregnant, 6 months ago) I talked to my favorite ob in the hallway and she says she will do an exam and order an ultrasound for me next month.  The thing about my gut instinct, is that i dont have one.  I have anxiety, so every thing feels wrong to me :(  Ive had 4 moles removed in the past 4 months because of gut feelings, after the derm said they were completely fine, and they were....Im absolutely going to follow thru with this because i dont think I can function if i dont.  Thank you for your response.  Thats the thing about these forums :)  Most of the people on here have breast cancer so most of the responses are kinda scarey.  I thank you and pray for you all.
Posts.Title: Question about a tender spot in breast, No lumps. kehjj04 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: May 27, 2011 09:10AM kehjj04 wrote: well thats the thing, there is really no "lump" to be felt.  There is just an area that is painful when i push on it.  The breast tissue is a little thicker there and has been for a few years.  I have had one mammo about 8 months ago (baseline on the side that is bothering me now and diagnostic on the right side, which turned out to be compressed breast tissue from a rib)  I had a breast exam at the drs in December and the pain started in February, and its more of a tenderness than a pain, and only when i push on it.  I was very suprised at how my first dr blew me off but am satisifed with having the ultrasound and seeing my surgeon.  I dont want to jump the gun and start asking for all these tests before i have my ultrasound and im also REALLY trying to stay on the right side of the line, if you know what i mean.  I know from being on here that there are ladies whos cancer didnt show up on a mammo and didnt how up on the ultrasound but i cant go there in my head because i will drive myself absolutely crazy and end up hacking chunks of my breasts off everytime i have an issue (ive had 2 other issues in the other breast prior that all turned out to be B9, thank the Lord)  Ill update as soon as i have my ultrasound!  Thank you all so much for the support.  I have no one else to talk to about my concerns/fears except my husband, and he doesnt have breasts, so he doesnt get it, at all.

Posts.Title: Question about a tender spot in breast, No lumps. kehjj04 22lifeisgood

Posts.Content: May 3, 2011 12:39PM kehjj04 wrote: Thank you so much for your response!  I had a big scare in october that seriously, ruined a peice of me forever.  I had a HARD long lump on the top of my breast.  I went to the dr and he said US immediately.  I have the us.  The tech says she sees nothing.  she goes back, comes into the room with the radiologist.  he feels the lump and does his own images with the US and then recommends a mammo.  Every US i have had before the tech always says "its a fluid filled cyst" and i go about my way to the surgeon and she agrees and then im done.  When he said i had to have a mammo i just about lost my marbles.  I sat at home and cried, and cried and cried.  I had the mammo.  The tech came back and said that she needed MORE images of the right side (they did a diagnostic on the right and a baseline on the left (the left is what im having issues with now) then sent me on my way.  I was FREAKING out, why did she need more images???  So, 3 weeks later i gather up all my tests and images and reports and take them to the surgeon (who, might i add, is a Godsend.  I love her to death) and she feels it, looks at all my stuff, does a VERY intesive breast exam and then tells me "honey, its just breast tissue over a rib"  I had lost tons of weight and was never able to feel this before (and its true, im 6 months pregnant and can barely feel this lump anymore with all the boob i have going on)  but honestly, i thought i had breast cancer with all of the tests and pushing me along.  I had to have the mammo because NOTHING showed up on the US, but no one told me that.  NOTHING showed up on the mammo, and no one told me that either.  It was terrifying.  After that i spiraled into severe health anxiety.  I had 4 moles biopsied because they looked funny to me (dr said they were fine but my "gut" said they were wrong)  I dont have a gut anymore because my gut tells me EVERYTHING is and feels wrong.  I was having no real breast issues until i got pregnant, which is what i keep telling myself to keep myself calm, but its hard, and im scared :(  Ill be happy to have my Ultrasound next month, see my surgeon and then move on with my life from this.  I have no one in my life to talk to about any of my fears.  My husband has his own health anxiety so when i talk about mine, it just makes his worse.  I have no close friends i can confide in and me and my mother dont speak.  This board has been a great deal of comfort and strenght for me.  I have very little to offer as far as advice but i am doing my best trying to contribute what i can to help others. XOXO
Posts.Title: Question about a tender spot in breast, No lumps. kehjj04 22lifeisgood

Posts.Title: Scared and need help JPC1987 leaf

Posts.Content: kehjj04 wrote: Tomorrow i meet with my breast surgeon to go over my ultrasound results.  My ob told me that the report came back as no abnormal findings and just normal glandular and fibrocystic tissue.  She also did an exam herself and said that while i have fibrocystic changes on both sides it is much more pronounced in the left breast, espically where i am having the tenderness. I am feeling good about my results and the surgeon is the last step to putting this scare behind me.  Instead of getting more at ease as the appointments approach, i get more and more anxious and start losing sleep and losing my "cool"   This appt was supposed to happen 2 weeks ago but they had to call to reschedule.  I am asking for prayers for inner peace and strenght and that the breast surgeon agrees with the findings, finds nothing else of concern and that i can move on from this stressful 4 month ordeal.  Oh a different note, my c-section date is only 40 days away!  I cannot wait to be holding my baby girl in my arms.  We are all so excited for her to be here! Thank you very much ladies, i cannot express in words how much i appreciate you all. Blessed to have all B9 results in the past. Praying for all B9 findings in the future. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: If you all could send up a prayer for me kehjj04 mrsnjband

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 12:49PM kehjj04 wrote: Hi ladies.  Well, as expected, everything went well :)  She said that she feels the same general lumpiness on both sides and that the pain is hormonal.  She did a VERY thorough exam, using alot of pressure in some areas to really feel in the tissue and there were a few spots that were tender that i had never felt before, in both breasts.  I feel like a fool a little.  2 OB/GYNS and one mid wife all told me that it felt fine and that the tenderness was just hormonal.  I had an ultrasound that showed nothing but fibro-glandular tissue and i STILL was SO scared that something was wrong.  Im glad i went thru it all though because now i can really just move on and "be happy" Im going to be leaving now.  Coming here for advice and support when i needed it was so beneficial for me and im so grateful to all of you who were here for me, but, it is also feeding my health related anxiety and i need to really work on that so that i can make my life everything that i want it to be, instead of a constant "waiting for the other shoe to drop" feeling in the pit of my stomache. I wish all of you the best and will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. Thank you so much for everything.
Posts.Title: If you all could send up a prayer for me kehjj04 mrsnjband

Posts.Content: May 1, 2011 01:56PM kehjj04 wrote: The place i go is very thorough.  After they do the images the tech goes back and sits while the radiologist reads my images.  She came back and said they needed more images of the right breast and did them right then and there.  She left, came back said everything looked great and i was all set.  Its a pretty small but efficient hospital so it was nice to not have to be called back and deal with the anxiety of waiting (they also did this with the breast ultrasound that i had first.  The tech went back while the radiologist read the images and then they BOTH came back and the radiologist did he own exam before recommending a mammogram.)

Posts.Content: May 27, 2011 09:21PM kehjj04 wrote: FABULOUS news!!!!  enjoy your long weekend!
Posts.Title: Lump felt but did not show up in Mammo or ultrasound PennStateMac kehjj04

Posts.Content: May 29, 2011 04:34PM kehjj04 wrote: it DOES sound really confusing.  If i were you, i would see the surgeon.  BC isnt something you want to mess around with and if the reports are confusing or conflicting, you can never be too safe.  Im sure that they will just do a simple FNB if its fluid filled (which is must be if they say its a cyst)  idk.  If i were you i would see a surgeon.  My OB sends me to a surgeon reguardless of what my report says.  all the diagnosic mammos and ultrasounds i have had have either been benign or a cyst and they STILL send me to the surgeon who looks at the films/dvd and reads the reports and then does her own exam and then give me her diagnosis.  Good luck hon
Posts.Title: I fall between the cracks Gottobme Gottobme

Posts.Content: May 1, 2011 07:40AM kehjj04 wrote: i have had a few lumps checked out.  A biopsy is what they do LAST, as far as ive seen.  For all of my lumps it was:  Dr exam, ultrasound, mammogram, breast surgeon with all of my films and reports.  Mine were all fluid filled cysts so i never needed or had a biopsy but from what ive always understood, biopsies came after all of the imaging.

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 07:41AM kehjj04 wrote: i really hope everything comes out ok for your mom too :)  After you find a lump the road is long and scary.  At 26 i have had a few scares and they never get any easier.

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2011 01:20PM kehjj04 wrote: they absolutely can do a mammogram if you are pregnant.  They will cover your tummy with a shield and it is perfectly safe.  If you should need one of course.
Posts.Title: Would an inverted nipple stay inverted if it was breast cancer? merrysee kehjj04

Posts.Content: May 12, 2011 07:26AM kehjj04 wrote: i have VERY fibrocystic lumpy breasts and that has always been protocol for me.  I see my dr, get an ultrasound (and once i had a mammo because they couldent find anything on the US) then i take all of my stuff to the BS and she reads everything, gives me a good exam (commenting on how lumpy my breasts are) and tells me they are benign cysts.  I have to let it go there.  I cant insist on a biopsy everytime i feel a lump.  I put my faith in the Lord (and the WONDERFUL breast surgeon that i have) that they are in fact benign.  I will be praying for you!  (and im in the waiting game too.  Ill have an ultrasound on a tender area in my breast in about 3 weeks.  the waiting is the worst)
Posts.Title: What are the odds of 6 lumps being benign? kennessee Laleesa

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2011 01:10PM kehjj04 wrote: waiting is the worst.  I have been waiting since February to have a tender spot in my breast checked out.  Im 30 weeks pregnant so my drs had a "its hormonal lets changes a few things and see what happens" attitude.  I did all they asked (even cut out my ONE daily cup of coffee!!) and it is still tender.  My doctors feel no lump but they say they do feel fibrocystic changes so after MONTHS of waiting i FINALLY have my ultrasound today.  For me the key to waiting is taking it day by day.  Keep yourself busy (easy for me i have 3 kids under 6) and keep a positive attitdue.  My matra is "i am healthy and strong.  Today i am healthy, and tomorrow, if im not, God will never give me more than i can handle"  As so many ladies on here site, 95% of them will survive this awful disease.  I am strong, i am a fighter, if God forbid this turns out to be something serious i know i caught it early (i felt the tenderness doing a SBE, which i do monthly) and i know that i can fight and win.  You have to be positive, the negative is what will drag you down.  ((Hugs)) let us know how you get on.
Posts.Title: All this waiting!!! Sichernde Sichernde
